alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 9:56PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wyandotte, northwestern Miami, eastern Johnson, Clay, southeastern Platte and Jackson Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 956 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake Waukomis to near Overland Park to near Edgerton. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Olathe, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Shawnee, Blue Springs, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Liberty, Gladstone, Grandview, Prairie Village, Gardner, Grain Valley, Excelsior Springs, Merriam, Mission and Smithville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 417 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 32. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 211 and 217, and between mile markers 220 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 10. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 1, and between mile markers 38 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas...and northwestern and west central Missouri.
